item.title: How to Access USB Drive That Linux Booted From
item.description: Been a long time ago i’m trying linux liveUSB, and the present i try it again. Intent of this act is grabing data from laptop without operating system. In my case i’m using bunsenLabs, the debian based linux distro. I want to the data stored on USB drive that linux booted from. Here is the solution. Check where USB drive mounted lsblk But, usually liveUSB drive mounted on /lib/live/mount/medium Remount USB device
